translation.text: He is the Giver of all souls.

melody.description: Raag Majh was composed by the Fifth Sikh Guru (Shri Guru Arjun Dev ji). The Raag’s origins are based in Punjabi Folk Music and its essence was inspired by the Majha regions traditions of ‘Ausian’; the game of waiting and yearning for the return of a loved one.The feelings evoked by this Raag have often been compared to that of a mother waiting for her child to return after a long period of separation. She has an anticipation and hope for the child’s return, although at the same moment she is painfully aware of the uncertainty of their return home. This Raag brings to life the emotion of extreme love and this is highlighted by the sorrow and anguish of separation.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, He blesses us with His Glance of Grace.

text: ਜਲ ਥਲ ਮਹੀਅਲ ਸਭਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਾਣੇ ਸਾਧੂ ਚਰਨ ਪਖਾਲੀ ਜੀਉ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The beings in the water, on the land and in the sky are all satisfied; I wash the Feet of the Holy. ||3||

transliteration.text: jal thal mahīal sabh tripatānē sādhū charan pakhālī jīu .3.

translation.text: He is the Fulfiller of the desires of the mind.

translation.text: Forever and ever, I am a sacrifice to Him.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਦਾਨੁ ਕੀਆ ਦੁਖ ਭੰਜਨਿ ਰਤੇ ਰੰਗਿ ਰਸਾਲੀ ਜੀਉ ॥੪॥੩੨॥੩੯॥

translation.text: O Nanak, the Destroyer of pain has given this Gift; I am imbued with the Love of the Delightful Lord. ||4||32||39||

transliteration.text: nānak dān kīā dukh bhanjan ratē rang rasālī jīu .4.32.39.

text: ਮਨੁ ਤਨੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਧਨੁ ਭੀ ਤੇਰਾ ॥

translation.text: Mind and body are Yours; all wealth is Yours.

transliteration.text: man tan tērā dhan bhī tērā .

text: ਜੀਉ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਸਭੁ ਰਾਸਿ ਤੁਮਾਰੀ ਤੇਰਾ ਜੋਰੁ ਗੋਪਾਲਾ ਜੀਉ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Body and soul and all riches are Yours. Yours is the Power, O Lord of the World. ||1||

transliteration.text: jīu pind sabh rās tumārī tērā jōr gōpālā jīu .1.

translation.text: I bow down and fall at Your Feet.

text: ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਵਾ ਜੇ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵਾ ਜਾ ਤੂੰ ਦੇਹਿ ਦਇਆਲਾ ਜੀਉ ॥੨॥

translation.text: I act as it pleases You, as You cause me to act, Kind and Compassionate Dear Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: kār kamāvā jē tudh bhāvā jā tūn dēh daiālā jīu .2.

text: ਪ੍ਰਭ ਤੁਮ ਤੇ ਲਹਣਾ ਤੂੰ ਮੇਰਾ ਗਹਣਾ ॥

translation.text: O God, from You I receive; You are my decoration.

transliteration.text: prabh tum tē lahanā tūn mērā gahanā .

text: ਜੋ ਤੂੰ ਦੇਹਿ ਸੋਈ ਸੁਖੁ ਸਹਣਾ ॥

translation.text: Whatever You give me, brings me happiness.

transliteration.text: jō tūn dēh sōī sukh sahanā .

text: ਜਿਥੈ ਰਖਹਿ ਬੈਕੁੰਠੁ ਤਿਥਾਈ ਤੂੰ ਸਭਨਾ ਕੇ ਪ੍ਰਤਿਪਾਲਾ ਜੀਉ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Wherever You keep me, is heaven. You are the Cherisher of all. ||3||

transliteration.text: jithai rakhah baikunth tithāī tūn sabhanā kē pratipālā jīu .3.

text: ਸਗਲ ਮਨੋਰਥ ਪੂਰਨ ਹੋਏ ਕਦੇ ਨ ਹੋਇ ਦੁਖਾਲਾ ਜੀਉ ॥੪॥੩੩॥੪੦॥

translation.text: All my hopes and desires are fulfilled; I shall never again suffer sorrow. ||4||33||40||

text: ਜਲਿ ਥਲਿ ਮਹੀਅਲਿ ਦਹ ਦਿਸਿ ਵਰਸਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: Over the sea and over the land-over all the earth's surface, in all directions, He has brought the rain.

text: ਸਾਂਤਿ ਭਈ ਬੁਝੀ ਸਭ ਤ੍ਰਿਸਨਾ ਅਨਦੁ ਭਇਆ ਸਭ ਠਾਈ ਜੀਉ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Peace has come, and the thirst of all has been quenched; there is joy and ecstasy everywhere. ||1||

transliteration.text: sānht bhaī bujhī sabh trisanā anad bhaiā sabh thāī jīu .1.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He is the Giver of Peace, the Destroyer of pain.

melody.description: Raag Majh was composed by the Fifth Sikh Guru (Shri Guru Arjun Dev ji). The Raag’s origins are based in Punjabi Folk Music and its essence was inspired by the Majha regions traditions of ‘Ausian’; the game of waiting and yearning for the return of a loved one.The feelings evoked by this Raag have often been compared to that of a mother waiting for her child to return after a long period of separation. She has an anticipation and hope for the child’s return, although at the same moment she is painfully aware of the uncertainty of their return home. This Raag brings to life the emotion of extreme love and this is highlighted by the sorrow and anguish of separation.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He gives and forgives all beings.

melody.description: Raag Majh was composed by the Fifth Sikh Guru (Shri Guru Arjun Dev ji). She has an anticipation and hope for the child’s return, although at the same moment she is painfully aware of the uncertainty of their return home. This Raag brings to life the emotion of extreme love and this is highlighted by the sorrow and anguish of separation.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਅਪਨੇ ਕੀਤੇ ਨੋ ਆਪਿ ਪ੍ਰਤਿਪਾਲੇ ਪਇ ਪੈਰੀ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਮਨਾਈ ਜੀਉ ॥੨॥

translation.text: He Himself nurtures and cherishes His Creation. I fall at His Feet and surrender to Him. ||2||

transliteration.text: apanē kītē nō āp pratipālē pai pairī tisah manāī jīu .2.

melody.description: Raag Majh was composed by the Fifth Sikh Guru (Shri Guru Arjun Dev ji). text: ਜਾ ਕੀ ਸਰਣਿ ਪਇਆ ਗਤਿ ਪਾਈਐ ॥

translation.text: Seeking His Sanctuary, salvation is obtained.

transliteration.text: jā kī saran paiā gat pāīai .

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਬਿਨੁ ਹੋਰੁ ਨ ਦੂਜਾ ਠਾਕੁਰੁ ਸਭ ਤਿਸੈ ਕੀਆ ਜਾਈ ਜੀਉ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Without Him, there is no other Lord and Master. All places belong to Him. ||3||

transliteration.text: tis bin hōr n dūjā thākur sabh tisai kīā jāī jīu .3.

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਦਾਸੁ ਕਹੈ ਬੇਨੰਤੀ ਆਠ ਪਹਰ ਤੁਧੁ ਧਿਆਈ ਜੀਉ ॥੪॥੩੪॥੪੧॥

translation.text: Servant Nanak utters this prayer: may I meditate on You twenty-four hours a day. ||4||34||41||

transliteration.text: nānak dās kahai bēnantī āth pahar tudh dhiāī jīu .4.34.41.

translation.text: Maajh, Fifth Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None

translation.text: All happiness comes, when God is pleased.

text: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਕੇ ਚਰਣ ਮਨਿ ਵੁਠੇ ॥

translation.text: The Feet of the Perfect Guru dwell in my mind.

transliteration.text: gur pūrē kē charan man vuthē .

text: ਸਹਜ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਲਗੀ ਲਿਵ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਸੋ ਰਸੁ ਸੋਈ ਜਾਣੈ ਜੀਉ ॥੧॥

translation.text: I am intuitively absorbed in the state of Samaadhi deep within. God alone knows this sweet pleasure. ||1||

transliteration.text: sahaj samādh lagī liv antar sō ras sōī jānai jīu .1.

text: ਸਦਾ ਅਲਿਪਤੁ ਜੀਆ ਕਾ ਦਾਤਾ ਕੋ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਆਪੁ ਪਛਾਣੈ ਜੀਉ ॥੨॥

translation.text: He is always detached; He is the Giver of souls. How rare is that person who understands his own self. ||2||

transliteration.text: sadā alipat jīā kā dātā kō viralā āp pashānai jīu .2.

text: ਸਹਜਿ ਸੰਤੋਖਿ ਸਦਾ ਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਾਸੇ ਅਨਦੁ ਖਸਮ ਕੈ ਭਾਣੈ ਜੀਉ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Intuitive peace and poise, contentment, enduring satisfaction and bliss come through the Pleasure of the Master's Will. ||3||

transliteration.text: sahaj santōkh sadā tripatāsē anad khasam kai bhānai jīu .3.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਦਾਸ ਕੀਏ ਪ੍ਰਭਿ ਅਪੁਨੇ ਹਰਿ ਕੀਰਤਨਿ ਰੰਗ ਮਾਣੇ ਜੀਉ ॥੪॥੩੫॥੪੨॥

translation.text: O Nanak, those whom God has made His slaves, rejoice in the pleasure of singing the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises. ||4||35||42||

transliteration.text: nānak dās kīē prabh apunē har kīratan rang mānē jīu .4.35.42.
